item.title: OASIS announces RELAX, TREX to form RELAX NG
item.description: OASIS announced the renaming of the TREX technical committee to RELAX NG, reflecting "their decision to integrate TREX and RELAX in order to collaborate on a unified lightweight specification for validating XML-based languages."

item.title: New drafts for URI processing on DNS
item.description: The IETF released two new drafts of A DDDS Database Using The Domain Name System and Assignment Procedures for the URI Resolution using DNS.

item.title: XHTML 1.1 reaches Recommendation
item.description: The W3C has released XHTML 1.1 as a W3C Recommendation, as well as a new XHTML module, Ruby Annotation.

item.title: W3C workshop on XML key management
item.description: The W3C is holding a workshop on XML key management in Redwood City, California, on 19 July 2001, to consider the requirements for simple key resolution and trust services for XML security applications.

item.title: SVG renderer for UML diagrams
item.description: Christian Nentwich has created BOX, a tool that takes UML diagrams in XMI format and renders them in either SVG or Microsoft's VML format.

item.title: New Perl XML modules
item.description: Matt Sergeant has released several new Perl/XML modules: XML::LibXML, XML::Handler::HTMLWriter and XML::Filter::Base.
